keyTakeAways: A man, Billy Joe Cagle, was arrested at Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport after his family reported he planned to shoot up the airport via social media livestream.
Cagle, a convicted felon from Cartersville, Georgia, was found in possession of an AR-15 assault rifle and 27 rounds of ammunition in his Chevrolet pickup truck.
The incident was prevented due to early warning from family members who alerted law enforcement after seeing Cagle’s social media threat to 'shoot it up'.
Cagle had previously posted on Facebook indicating he was schizophrenic and taking medication, and expressed concern to a former high school friend, who reported his well-being to others.
Cagle was charged with making terroristic threats, criminal attempt to commit aggravated assault, possession of a firearm during the commission of a felony, and possession of a firearm by a felon.
Law enforcement and federal authorities are investigating how Cagle legally obtained the firearm, which he was not legally allowed to possess.
The arrest is seen as a success due to the proactive role of family members and the timely intervention by police, preventing a potential mass casualty event at one of the world’s busiest airports.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Billy Joe Cagle, a 49-year-old convicted felon from Cartersville, Georgia, was arrested at Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport after family members alerted law enforcement that he had streamed on social media a plan to 'shoot it up' the airport. Officers found an AR-15 assault rifle and 27 rounds of ammunition in his Chevrolet pickup truck parked outside the terminal. Cagle, who had previously posted on Facebook about being schizophrenic and taking medication, was charged with terroristic threats, criminal attempt to commit aggravated assault, and unlawful firearm possession. The incident underscores how early warnings from family and community members can prevent mass violence, especially at high-traffic public locations like one of the world's busiest airports. Police and federal officials are investigating how he legally obtained the firearm, which he was not permitted to possess. The event is seen as a success due to timely intervention and public vigilance.
title: Man Arrested at Atlanta Airport After Social Media Threat to 'Shoot It Up'
